#1.Define variables

N = 100
blood_types = ['A','B','AB','O']
Count = [30,24,8,38]

#2. Define figure and axes

fig, ax = plt.subplots(1,2,figsize = [16,6])

#3. Plot Charts

ax[0].grid(False)
ax[1].grid(False)
plt.style.use("bmh")
colors = ['#003f5c','#7a5195','#ef5675','#ffa600'] #I use "learnui.design" for generating Color combination

Bar_chart = ax[0].bar(blood_types,Count,label = blood_types,color=colors,width = 0.35)
ax[0].set_title('Frequency by Blood Types',Fontsize = 16)
ax[0].set_ylabel('Frequency')
ax[0].set_xlabel('Blood Type')
ax[0].bar_label(Bar_chart,label_type='edge')
ax[0].set_facecolor("#eee8d5")

ax[1].pie(Count,explode = (0.1, 0.1, 0.1, 0.1),labels=blood_types,autopct='%1i%%',colors=colors,startangle=90, pctdistance=0.85)
ax[1].set_title('Blood Types Proportion',Fontsize = 16)

centre_circle = plt.Circle((0,0),0.70,fc='white')
fig_1 = plt.gcf()
fig_1.gca().add_artist(centre_circle)

#1. Define Variables 

Age = [5,7,8,7,2,17,2,9,4,11,12,9,6]
Score = [99,86,87,88,111,86,103,87,94,78,77,85,86]

fig_scatter = plt.figure(dpi = 100)

**As you can see there is an important difference between "Histogram" and "Bar chart".**

Bar chart needs a categorical variable like bloodtypes, but Histogram is representation of the distribution of numerical data. It slices numerical data in equal distances and count the frequency of each slice!

So, Bar chart should use for categorical data and Histogram should use for numerical ones!
